```{r message = FALSE, warning = FALSE}

library(tidyverse)
library(readxl)
library(plotly)

```



This is my import procedure.

```{r}

url <- "https://github.com/philbowsher/Foundation-of-the-R-Workflow-workshop-2019-09-06/raw/master/Examples/data/ad_treatment.xlsx"
destfile <- "ad_treatment.xlsx"
curl::curl_download(url, destfile)
ad_treatment <- read_excel(destfile)
ad_treatment
```


This is my awesome data Viz

```{r}

p<-ad_treatment %>%
  group_by(drug_treatment) %>% 
  summarize(mmse = mean(mmse)) %>% 
  ungroup() %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x=drug_treatment, y = mmse)) +
  geom_col()+
  theme_classic()

plotly::ggplotly(p)
```

```{r}
library(dygraphs)
dygraph(nhtemp, main = "New Haven Temperatures") %>% 
  dyRangeSelector(dateWindow = c("1920-01-01", "1960-01-01"))
```
